info.title: Ring API
info.description: Presents developer entry points to HCL DX 9.5 core platform capabilities.

post.description: This request creates a new permission.

200.description: Returns a newly created permission.

400.description: Returns status 400 - Bad Request. It is a client side error that may be a result of either JSON format error or request data validation error. (e.g., input parameters are missing or invalid).

401.description: Returns a status 401 - Unauthorized error. Usually the user is not authenticated or logged in or the authentication token is not sent.

403.description: Returns a status 403 - Forbidden error. Check for out of scope user roles or permissions.

404.description: Returns a status 404 - Not Found error. Usually if the resource is not found or if there is a mistyped endpoints.

422.description: Returns status 422 - Unprocessable Entity error. Status 400 is usually used in place of this error status in the case the request data failed the validations.

500.description: Returns status 500 - Internal Server Error. This an unexpected error which was not handled on the server side, usually an undefined or null error, or a promise rejection error.

parameters.name: Cookie
parameters.description: Contains the access or authentication token. Leave this field empty if you are already authenticated, unless you intend to put a token value.

parameters.description: The virtual portal name, if any, to which this request will be applied, otherwise leave this field empty.

parameters.description: The unique name of the role (e.g. User).

parameters.description: The ID of the type. (e.g., user, group, virtual). Note: This is a required parameter

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset attribute of user/group search list. This specifies the offset of the first item in a collection to be returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit attribute of user/group search list. This constrains the number of items-per-page in a collection returned by a request.

parameters.name: filterAttr
parameters.description: The filter attribute of user/group search list.

parameters.name: filterVal
parameters.description: The filter value of user/group search list.

parameters.name: memberOf
parameters.description: The member of value in user/group search list.

parameters.name: expandRefs
parameters.description: Boolean value that determines if the complete profiles are embedded in the references.

parameters.name: includeAttributes
parameters.description: List that specifies which attributes contained within the profiles are returned. By default, if this parameter is omitted, all attributes that hold values are returned.

parameters.name: sortByAttributes
parameters.description: List of attribute names that specifies the sort order for the results. This is only supported for a paged search.

parameters.name: descending
parameters.description: Boolean value that determines if the sort direction for attributes will be descending. This is based on the sequence of attributes in sortByAttributes.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: This parameter is used to restrict the number of items that are returned by a request to a set number. It can be used with the page parameter to return specific pages of the results (default value is 100). (e.g., to restrict the number of queries to be returned to 5, set limit to 5).

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: This parameter is used with the pagesize parameter to define what set of results to display (e.g., if pagesize is set to 5, and the page parameter is set to 2, then only results 6 - 10 are displayed).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: This parameter is appended to queries to determine how query results are sorted. Multiple options can be selected.

parameters.name: titleLike
parameters.description: This parameter is used as a wildcard query for items with titles like the specified titlelike parameter (e.g., titleApproxValue%).

parameters.name: titleLikeIgnoreCase
parameters.description: This parameter is used as a wildcard query for items with titles like the specified titlelike parameter while ignoring the letter case (e.g., titleApproxValue%).

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: This parameter is used as a wildcard query for items with names like the specified namelike parameter (e.g., nameApproxValue%).

parameters.name: nameLikeIgnoreCase
parameters.description: This parameter is used as a wildcard query for items with names like the specified namelike parameter while ignoring the letter case (e.g., nameApproxValue%).

parameters.name: titleOrNameLike
parameters.description: This parameter is used to join the query results of nameLike, nameLikeIgnoreCase, titleLike, and titleLikeIgnoreCase (e.g., true).

parameters.name: libraryID
parameters.description: This parameter is used to query items that are stored in a specific library (e.g., 18cfc80c-a490-4d75-9057-fed3db89de53).

parameters.name: parentID
parameters.description: This parameter is used to query items that are the children of a specific parent item (e.g., 18cfc80c-a490-4d75-9057-fed3db89de53).

All other parameters, such as parentID or type, remain valid, allowing one to, for example, locate all libraries on which the user has the Editor role. User, Editor, Admin, Manager, and Contributor are all valid roles.

parameters.description: This parameter is used to query items that were last modified by a specific user. A user UID must be specified when this parameter is used (e.g., uid=WCMUT_Editor_A,o=defaultWIMFileBasedRealm).

parameters.description: This parameter is used to query items that are created after a specific date and time (e.g., 2011-01-11T11:43:29.0150Z).

parameters.name: expiredBefore

parameters.name: expiredAfter
parameters.description: This parameter is used to query items that were expired after a specific date and time (e.g., 2011-01-11T11:43:29.0150Z).

get.description: This request returns a list of site areas depending on the search filters and pagination values.

200.description: Returns a list of all site areas.

400.description: Returns status 400 - Bad Request. It is a client side error that may be a result of either JSON format error or request data validation error. (e.g., input parameters are missing or invalid).

401.description: Returns a status 401 - Unauthorized error. Usually the user is not authenticated or logged in or the authentication token is not sent.

404.description: Returns a status 404 - Not Found error. Usually if the resource is not found or if there is a mistyped endpoints.

422.description: Returns status 422 - Unprocessable Entity error. Status 400 is usually used in place of this error status in the case the request data failed the validations.

500.description: Returns status 500 - Internal Server Error. This an unexpected error which was not handled on the server side, usually an undefined or null error, or a promise rejection error.

parameters.name: Cookie
parameters.description: Contains the access or authentication token. Leave this field empty if you are already authenticated, unless you intend to put a token value.

parameters.name: virtualportal
parameters.description: The virtual portal name, if any, to which this request will be applied, otherwise leave this field empty.

parameters.name: access_type
parameters.description: The access type of the user. Authenticated users should use 'dxmyrest', and an unauthenticated users should use 'dxrest'.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: This parameter is used to restrict the number of items that are returned by a request to a set number. It can be used with the page parameter to return specific pages of the results (default value is 100). (e.g., to restrict the number of queries to be returned to 5, set limit to 5).

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: This parameter is used with the pagesize parameter to define what set of results to display (e.g., if pagesize is set to 5, and the page parameter is set to 2, then only results 6 - 10 are displayed).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: This parameter is appended to queries to determine how query results are sorted. Multiple options can be selected.

parameters.name: titleLike
parameters.description: This parameter is used as a wildcard query for items with titles like the specified titlelike parameter (e.g., titleApproxValue%).

parameters.name: titleLikeIgnoreCase
parameters.description: This parameter is used as a wildcard query for items with titles like the specified titlelike parameter while ignoring the letter case (e.g., titleApproxValue%).

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: This parameter is used as a wildcard query for items with names like the specified namelike parameter (e.g., nameApproxValue%).

parameters.name: nameLikeIgnoreCase
parameters.description: This parameter is used as a wildcard query for items with names like the specified namelike parameter while ignoring the letter case (e.g., nameApproxValue%).

parameters.name: titleOrNameLike
parameters.description: This parameter is used to join the query results of nameLike, nameLikeIgnoreCase, titleLike, and titleLikeIgnoreCase (e.g., true).

parameters.name: libraryID
parameters.description: This parameter is used to query items that are stored in a specific library (e.g., 18cfc80c-a490-4d75-9057-fed3db89de53).

parameters.name: parentID
parameters.description: This parameter is used to query items that are the children of a specific parent item (e.g., 18cfc80c-a490-4d75-9057-fed3db89de53).
